description: To carry out tree surgery including a crown reduction by 2m to previous points and remove epicormic from trunk and main branches two Oaks, T4 and T5 on TPO 93A
application_type_full: Tree works: Trees in conservation areas/subject to TPOs
decision_conditions: The removal of deadwood, dangerous / hanging branches and ivy:  This does not require the formal consent of the Council.

Statutory crown lifting of trees: This does not require formal consent of the Council if the clearance only involves the removal of branches to give a separation between the footway and the tips of the lowest branches by up to 2.3m or the carriageway by up to 5.2m.

The two mature Oak trees are situated in the front of the property. They are in good condition and have fair form considering previous pruning. They can be seen by neighbours, road and path users giving them a high amenity value.

Due to the high amenity of the trees, it is important to base decisions on tree health and arboricultural reasons. The tree has been pruned recently and cutting it this soon prevents the trees ability to gather energy through photosynthesis.
This application is refused as there are a lack of arboricultural reasons. With the trees far enough from the property to be causing issues, another years growth would be beneficial to the trees.
